goal.tools.mc.core

Interface Automaton

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    Program, Property
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    GOALProg, GOALPrologProg, LTL2AUTProp, Product

    public interface Automaton
    Represents the structure of an automaton. Implementations may decide how to store the automaton internally.
    Author:
    sungshik

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void generate()
      Generates the entire state space of the automaton.
      State getInitial()
      Gets the initial state of the automaton.
      int getSize()
      Gets the number of states for which successors have been defined (this is not necessarily equal to the number of states that have already been identified).
      State[] getSuccessors(State q)
      Gets the successors of q.

    • Method Detail

      • generate

        void generate()
        Generates the entire state space of the automaton. Although implementations of this interface may decide how the automaton is represented and stored internally, it is assumed that some internal storage facility is present (otherwise, this method would not make much sense).

      • getInitial

        State getInitial()
        Gets the initial state of the automaton.
        Returns:
        The initial state of the automaton.

      • getSize

        int getSize()
        Gets the number of states for which successors have been defined (this is not necessarily equal to the number of states that have already been identified).
        Returns:
        The number of states for which successors have been defined.

      • getSuccessors

        State[] getSuccessors(State q)
        Gets the successors of q.
        Parameters:
        q - - The state to get the successors of.
        Returns:
        The successors of q.
